items.title: Using BytesIO with pdftotext
items.body:
Hi,

Thank you for working on this excellent library!

I'm trying to adapt `pdftotext` to work with pulling down PDFs from the web. I've tried to use a `BytesIO` instance to create a `File`-like interface for `pdftotext`, but I'm running into an error. Here's some sample code:

```
r = requests.get('MYPDFWEBSITE.pdf')
bytes = BytesIO(r.content)
pdf = pdftotext.PDF(bytes)
```

But I'm running into this error: `pdftotext.Error: poppler error creating document`. When I download the PDF onto my computer, and load it in via `with open()`, everything seems to work. Would appreciate any guidance/help on this

cc @jalan

items.title: Infinite loop for extracting some PDF files
items.body: When the program extracts some PDF files, it will loop forever to read the content of the file event it few hundred kilobytes file until exhausted the PHP max memory or reach the max execution time.

items.title: Aborted (core dumped)
items.body:
Hi there, your software is really good and I'm using it to extract text from some pdfs but unfortunately i  I encountered an error that appears when I try text from probably harmed pdfs (they don't open on my computer).
Reproduce issue:
```
import requests
import pdftotext

r = requests.get("https://ttd.gov/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/3-4-19-Commission-Packet.pdf")
open("crash.pdf", "wb").write(r.content)
with open("crash.pdf", "rb") as f:
	text = pdftotext.PDF(f)
	print(list(text))
```
output: `Aborted (core dumped)`

And my script is falling down without an opportunity to handle it with exception.
May be there is another way to handle this error? for my script got next file to extract

items.title: Deprecation warning due to invalid escape sequences
items.body:
Deprecation warnings are raised due to invalid escape sequences. This can be fixed by using raw strings or escaping the literals. pyupgrade also helps in automatic conversion : https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade/

```
find . -iname '*.py' | grep -v example | xargs -P4 -I{} python3.8 -Wall -m py_compile {}
./setup.py:34: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \i
  include_dirs = [os.path.join(conda_prefix, "Library\include")]
./setup.py:35: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \l
  library_dirs = [os.path.join(conda_prefix, "Library\lib")]
```

items.title: Can't install via pip in Alpine Linux 3.11
items.body:
Trying to install pdftotext==2.1.4 version.
There is a [poppler package](https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/package/v3.11/main/x86_64/poppler) in Alpine repo, which includes poppler-dev, poppler-doc, poppler-glib, poppler-utils as subpackages...  
My Dockerfile:
```Dockerfile
# precompiled python wheels for pandas and numpy => faster docker build
FROM nickgryg/alpine-pandas
# install dependencies
# the lapack package is only in the community repository
RUN echo "http://dl-4.alpinelinux.org/alpine/edge/community" >> /etc/apk/repositories
# Install dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache --virtual .build-deps \
    gfortran \
    musl-dev \
    g++
RUN ln -s /usr/include/locale.h /usr/include/xlocale.h
RUN apk --update add --no-cache \
    freetype-dev \
    lapack-dev \
    gcc \
    poppler

COPY . /app
WORKDIR /app
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt

# removing dependencies to limit the size of your image
RUN apk del .build-deps
```

items.title: Importing Pandas messes up raw mode
items.body:
After importing `pandas`, using `raw=True` fails silently with the result being an arbitrarily short string of the beginning of each pdf page. The length of the string is different on each run.

Steps to reproduce:

1. In a new shell import `pdftotext` and run `pdftotext.PDF(<filename>, raw=True)` to test for successful result.
2. Import `pandas`.
3. Run again the same test.

Python `3.8.0`; pdftotext `2.1.2`; pandas `0.25.3`

items.title: Unable to install poppler-cpp-devel and python-devel on RHEL 8
items.body:
Hi Jalan
As per official documentation on pdftotext webpage below libraries are required to be installed on REDHAT.
sudo yum install gcc-c++ pkgconfig poppler-cpp-devel python-devel redhat-rpm-config

Unfortunately i was unable to install poppler-cpp-devel and python-devel  and received below message:
sudo yum install poppler-cpp-devel python-devel
Red Hat Update Infrastructure 3 Client Configur 7.4 kB/s | 2.1 kB     00:00
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 for x86_64 - AppStre 8.1 kB/s | 2.8 kB     00:00
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 for x86_64 - BaseOS  7.5 kB/s | 2.3 kB     00:00
No match for argument: poppler-cpp-devel
No match for argument: python-devel
Error: Unable to find a match

I tried to install poppler from it's official linux webpage which is given below and went recursively and installed almost 10 dependencies such as cmake, libarchieve, fontconfig and the list went on.
http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/blfs/view/svn/general/poppler.html

Finally i have come to a stage where getting below error while installing pdftotext through pip3.
pip3 install pdftotext
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.6
g++ -pthread -shared -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now -specs=/usr/lib/rpm/redhat/redh                                                                             at-hardened-ld -g build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.6/pdftotext.o -L/usr/lib64 -lpoppler                                                                             -cpp -lpython3.6m -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.6/pdftotext.cpython-36m-x86_64-lin                                                                             ux-gnu.so
    /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lpoppler-cpp
    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
    error: command 'g++' failed with exit status 1

I am unable to understand above error and don't know how many more will be faced as i am working on same from 5 days.
It would be great if you can provide the libraries which are required for pdftotext and can be installed on REDHAT directly or without causing much errors.
We will be really grateful for your response.

items.title: Program Stuck with a pdf
items.body:
While extracting text from this pdf:
http://ihassociation.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/2014-ASHP-Handbook-web-edition.pdf

The program just gets stuck.

Reproduce:

```python
import pdftotext

with open('./2014-ASHP-Handbook-web-edition.pdf', 'rb') as f:
    pdf = pdftotext.PDF(f)
text = "\n\n".join(pdf)
```

I tried to iterate through the pages and there is a specific page in which the program is stuck on.
The program is stuck and uses 100% cpu which means it keeps processing something.

If its a dependecies problem, adding timeout for processing would be good.

items.title: Segmentation Fault with pdf
items.body:
Hey,

I've encountered with a pdf which cause a segmetation fault.

How to reproduce:
`import pdftotext

with open("seg_fault.pdf", "rb") as f:
    pdf = pdftotext.PDF(f)

print("\n\n".join(pdf))`

The file:
[seg_fault.pdf](https://github.com/jalan/pdftotext/files/3665507/seg_fault.pdf)

Using the newest versions of the dependencies on Ubuntu 16.04:

> build-essential is already the newest version (12.1ubuntu2).
pkg-config is already the newest version (0.29.1-0ubuntu1).
libpoppler-cpp-dev is already the newest version (0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14).
python-dev is already the newest version (2.7.12-1~16.04).

And python 3.6.8 with:

> pdftotext                             2.1.2

items.title: Set C++ version based on Poppler version?
items.body:
Poppler 0.69 and later claim to require C++14. The build works without any effort on common systems, but some systems need help. For example, anaconda on macOS might say

```
error: expected ‘,’ or ‘...’ before ‘&&’ token
```

items.title: Extract text line by line
items.body: Is there a way to extract text line-by-line instead of page-by-page. There aren't helpful `\n`'s in the code for this. I guess I could always just create a new line every set number of characters. Just wondering if this is a built-in feature.

items.title: Unknown symbols found in scientific literature
items.body: Hi, I'm trying to convert a PDF from a scientific journal to a text file, but many of the characters such as the "~" sign and Greek symbols do not get read/converted correctly. For example: Original text: Converted text: Is there a straightforward fix for this? Thanks!

items.title: fails on latin-1 encoded pdfs
items.body:
If you try and access a latin-1 encoded pdf it gives the following error,

UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 10: invalid continuation byte

poppler supports latin-1 encodings in the api, but apparently it isn't implemented in pdftotext, would appreciate it.

items.title: No additional option to ignore header and footer text
items.body: Is there any option to ignore the contents of header and footer text while extracting?

items.title: Fix description on PyPI
items.body:
The markdown description at https://pypi.org/project/pdftotext/ isn't rendered right. Maybe my tools were out of date last time I uploaded. The minimum versions are
 - setuptools >= 38.6.0
 - wheel >= 0.31.0
 - twine >= 1.11.0

items.title: Use Ubuntu 16.04 for all CI builds
items.body: It looks like Travis CI finally has full support for Ubuntu 16.04: https://blog.travis-ci.com/2018-11-08-xenial-release

items.title: Only run coveralls on one build
items.body: Otherwise, coveralls makes a separate comment for every run, as seen in #26

Thanks!

pkg-config and poppler are installed via brew. Then pdftotext is installed via pip. 
When I tried to import it in a Jupyter Notebook (conda env, python3) :

```
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-104-46fa7238b159> in <module>()
----> 1 import pdftotext

ImportError: dlopen(/Users/[username]/miniconda3/envs/[env-name]/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pdftotext.cpython-36m-darwin.so, 2): Symbol not found: __ZN7poppler24set_debug_error_functionEPFvRKSsPvES2_
  Referenced from: /Users/[username]/miniconda3/envs/[env-name]/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pdftotext.cpython-36m-darwin.so
  Expected in: flat namespace
 in /Users/[username]/miniconda3/envs/[env-name]/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pdftotext.cpython-36m-darwin.so
```

items.title: Can't install on MacOS via pip
items.body:
Running pip, with or without su, on MacOS produces the following error:

> Command "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Resources/Python.app/Contents/MacOS/Python -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/private/var/folders/cm/60_4h2mj23d_70fhqwvtjf7m0000gn/T/pip-build-bd88s9/pdftotext/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /var/folders/cm/60_4h2mj23d_70fhqwvtjf7m0000gn/T/pip-eNla3s-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile" failed with error code 1 in /private/var/folders/cm/60_4h2mj23d_70fhqwvtjf7m0000gn/T/pip-build-bd88s9/pdftotext/

This library is DOA until the dependency issue is resolved.

items.title: Add automated coverage checks
items.body: Should be able to rig something up with gcov, [coveralls.io](https://coveralls.io), [cpp-coveralls](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/cpp-coveralls)

items.title: [1]    8329 segmentation fault (core dumped)  python for password protected PDFs
TypeError: 'pdftotext.PDF' object has no attribute '__getitem__'
items.body:
This does not work:

```
import pdftotext

def get_text(filepath, page=None):
    """
    Extract text from a PDF

    Parameters
    ----------
    filepath : str
        Path to a PDF file
    page : int or None

    Returns
    -------
    text : str
    """
    with open(filepath) as f:
        pdf = pdftotext.PDF(f)
    if page is not None:
        text = pdf[page]
    else:
        text = pdf.read_all()
    return text
```

It returns:

```
TypeError: 'pdftotext.PDF' object has no attribute '__getitem__'
```

items.title: Some text may be missed on landscape pages
items.body: See https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=94517 and https://github.com/ropensci/pdftools/issues/7, where the same issue was encountered.

items.title: Is it possible to get coordinates of bounding boxes of each word of the text?
items.body: I would like to highlight parts of the PDF. Is it possible to get bounding boxes for each word in the PDF?

items.title: Allow PDF.read_all to be interrupted
items.body: Python extensions tend to not handle keyboard interrupts properly, but there is a `PyErr_CheckSignals` function to do it.
